definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Many women dream of a sleek and refined face contour.
sentences.chinese: 擁有一張纖細清秀的瓜子臉是衆多女士的夢想。

sentences.english: She is a typical frame, a small nose and mouth wide.
sentences.chinese: 她是一個典型的瓜子臉，小鼻子，嘴巴有點寬。

sentences.english: She has got an oval face, with wavy hair and a pair of big eyes.
sentences.chinese: 她有一張瓜子臉，波浪形的頭髮，一對大眼睛。

sentences.english: The news anchor has an oval face, and is very cameragenic.
sentences.chinese: 這位新聞主播有張瓜子臉，在鏡頭前很上相。

sentences.english: Her oval face makes her photogenic during photo-taking.
sentences.chinese: 她的瓜子臉讓她拍照時很上相。

sentences.english: There are many ways a face-lift, how can a simple shape melon face it?
sentences.chinese: 瘦臉方法有很多，怎樣才能簡單塑造瓜子臉呢？

definition: lit. cherry mouth (idiom)/fig. a delicate, ruby-lipped mouth
red phoenix eyes (eyes whose outer corners incline upwards)
see 櫻桃小嘴|樱桃小嘴[ying1 tao2 xiao3 zui3]
variant of 臉型|脸型, shape of face/physiognomy
(of a woman) to have nice curves/buxom/shapely
too weak to stand up to the wind (idiom); extremely delicate/fragile state of health
lit. capable of causing the downfall of a city or state (idiom)/fig. (of a woman) devastatingly beautiful
lit. not eating the food of common mortals/fig. placing oneself above the common populace
pinyin: bu4 shi2 ren2 jian1 yan1 huo3

definition: plump lower eyelids (considered to be an attractive feature)
